Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இகலானாம் இன்னாத எல்லாம் நகலானாம் நன்னயம் என்னும் செருக்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: All calamities are caused by hatred; but by the delight (of friendship) is caused the great wealth of good virtues.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition, divided by a central figure. On the left side, the figure is frowning with hostility ('இகல்'). From this hostility, all manner of evils and sorrows ('இன்னாத எல்லாம்') are born, visualized as a dark, thorny, desolate landscape.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right side, the same figure is smiling with friendship and delight ('நகல்'). From this delight, the noble pride of goodness and kindness ('நன்னயம் என்னும் செருக்கு') is born, visualized as a beautiful, flourishing, sunlit garden.
Layered_Composition.Background: The two landscapes stemming from the two emotions show the starkly different worlds created by hostility and friendliness.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: All bad things come from hostility; all the goodness of noble pride comes from friendliness.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The two contrasting landscapes—the thorny wasteland of hostility and the beautiful garden of friendliness—are the central metaphor.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Contrasting, creative (friendship) vs. destructive (hostility), a choice of worlds.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is dark, desolate, and full of harsh, cold colors. The right side is bright, vibrant, and full of warm, life-giving colors.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, symmetrical shot that clearly shows the two worlds being created by the central figure's emotional state.

Cultural_Anchors: From hostility comes all sorrow ('இகலான் ஆம் இன்னாத எல்லாம்')
From delight comes all good ('நகலான் ஆம் நன்னயம்')
